text:
="preserve">Kharmang District is a political sub-division of Pakistan. It is part of Baltistan and currently constitutes one of the ten districts of the Gilgit–Baltistan territory of Pakistan. It is bounded on the south by Kargil district of the Jammu and Kashmir, on the northeast by Ghanche District of GB, on the north by Skardu District of GB and on the west by Astore District of GB.
Kharmang District is one of the five biggest valleys of Baltistan; recently it became a district, whose headquarters is Temporarily at Tolti. The valley is located about 100 km from the capital city of Baltistan Skardu.
